ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It does not spare and does not ease up,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It leaves nothing, nor does it spare;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It spares nothing; it leaves nothing intact;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It leaves and spares no one and nothing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It spares not, nor does it leave (anything)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: It leaves naught nor does it spare aught.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: It spares not, neither leaves alone
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: It leaveth naught; it spareth naught
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It does not allow anyone to live, and neither does it leave anyone to die;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: It shall not spare, nor leave.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Naught doth it permit to endure, and naught doth it leave alone!-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: It spares not (any sinner), nor does it leave (anything unburnt)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:28] It neither spares nor leaves behind, anything of flesh or nerve, but destroys it [all], after which he is restored to his former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: It leaveth naught) any of their flesh except that it devours it; (It spareth naught) and it devours them when they are restored again to their former shape.
